item.name: Available memory
item.description: Available memory in bytes

item.name: Available swap
item.description: Available swap in bytes

item.name: bloxTools-move Service (Global)
item.description:
The Grid level availability of this service. The service is entirely down if this is not in a working state. All nodes should report the same thing for this item.
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown

item.name: bloxTools Service (Global)
item.description:
The Grid level availability of this service. The service is entirely down if this is not in a working state. All nodes should report the same thing for this item.
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown

item.name: Buffered memory
item.description: Buffered memory in bytes

item.name: Cached memory
item.description: Cached memory in bytes

item.name: CPU idle %
item.description: % of CPU spent idling

item.name: CPU idle time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles idling

item.name: CPU interrupt time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent on interrupt

item.name: CPU kernel time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent in kernel

item.name: CPU load avg (1 minute)
item.description: Average CPU load over 1 minute

item.name: CPU load avg (5 minute)
item.description: Average CPU load over 5 minutes

item.name: CPU load avg (15 minute)
item.description: Average CPU load over 15 minutes

item.name: CPU nice time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent on nice-ing processes

item.name: CPU system %
item.description: % of CPU time spent on system processes

item.name: CPU system time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent on system processes

item.name: CPU user %
item.description: % of CPU time spent on user processes

item.name: CPU user time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent on user processes

item.name: CPU wait time (raw)
item.description: Raw calculation of CPU cycles spent waiting on other processes

item.name: DDNS failed update
item.description: The number of all failed dynamic DNS updates, excluding those reported by the ibDDNSUpdateReject object.

item.name: DDNS prerequest rejected update
item.description: The number of dynamic DNS updates that failed because the rerequisites were not satisfied. This is also included in the total number of failures reported by the ibDDNSUpdateFailure object.

item.name: DDNS rejected update
item.description: The number of dynamic DNS updates that failed because they were denied by the DNS server.

item.name: DDNS successful update
item.description: The number of successful dynamic DNS updates.

item.name: DHCP Service (Global)
item.description:
The Grid level availability of this service. The service is entirely down if this is not in a working state. All nodes should report the same thing for this item.
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown

item.name: DNS Failure response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "Failure" DNS responses.

item.name: DNS hit ratio
item.description: From the MIB: IB-DNSONE-MIB::ibDnsHitRatio I believe this is the% of queries that hit the cache, but the admin guide omits this value, so who really knows?

item.name: DNS NxDomain response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "NxDomain" DNS responses.

item.name: DNS NxRRset response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "NxRRset" DNS responses.

item.name: DNS query rate
item.description: From the MIB: IB-DNSONE-MIB::ibDnsQueryRate I believe this is the queries per second, but the admin guide omits this value, so who really knows?

item.name: DNS Recursion response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "Recursion" DNS responses.

item.name: DNS Referral response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "Referral" DNS responses.

item.name: DNS Success response (summary)
item.description: Summary of "Success" DNS responses.

item.name: Total CPU usage in %
item.description: CPU usage in %

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total available memory in bytes

item.name: Total Memory usage in %
item.description: Memory usage in %

item.name: Total swap
item.description: Total swap in bytes

item.name: Zone transfer count
item.description: Total number of successful zone transfers from an Infoblox primary or secondary DNS server to a DNS client, since the DNS service was last restarted. Note that this counter tracks the number of successful full zone transfers (AXFRs) and incremental zone transfers (IXFRs)

discovery_rule.name: DHCP Networks
discovery_rule.description: List of DHCP networks. Used to determine capacity, etc. about a dhcp network/scope.

trigger_prototype.name: DHCP scope {#SNMPVALUE} has less than 20% free on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: The DHCP scope has less than 20% free space in it. IP allocation should be investigated to see if stale entries are sitting on reserved leases, if there is a need to increase the scope, or if someone has spun up an excessive amount of DHCP hosts on this network.

discovery_rule.name: DNS response discovery
discovery_rule.description: List of DNS zones in default view that we can pull stats on.

item_prototype.name: DNS - Failure response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of failure responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

item_prototype.name: DNS - NxDomain response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of NxDomain responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

item_prototype.name: DNS - NxRRset response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of NxRRset responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

item_prototype.name: DNS - Recursion response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of recursion responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

item_prototype.name: DNS - Referral response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of referral responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

item_prototype.name: DNS - Successful response ($1)
item_prototype.description: Number of success responses on {HOST.NAME} since the daemon started.

trigger_prototype.name: More FAILED DNS responses than SUCCESS on {HOST.NAME}
trigger_prototype.description: There are more DNS query responses of type "FAILED" than of type "SUCCESS". This could mean the upstream DNS resolvers are offline, or that a zone file got messed up.

discovery_rule.name: Node replication discovery
discovery_rule.description: List of nodes participating in replication.

item_prototype.name: Last replication time from $1 to master
item_prototype.description: The last time a replication completed from {#SNMPVALUE} to master.

item_prototype.name: Last replication time from master from $1
item_prototype.description: The last time a replication completed from master to {#SNMPVALUE}.

item_prototype.name: Replication queue from $1 to master
item_prototype.description: Number of items in the queue to be sent from {#SNMPVALUE} to the grid master.

item_prototype.name: Replication queue from master to $1
item_prototype.description: Number of items in the queue to be sent from the grid master to {#SNMPVALUE}.

item_prototype.name: Replication status on $1
item_prototype.description:
Online = good Offline = bad
Status of replication between {#SNMPVALUE} and the grid master.

trigger_prototype.name: Replication Offline for host $1
trigger_prototype.description: {#SNMPVALUE} is not participating in replication with the grid master.

trigger.name: bloxTools-move service not working on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
bloxTools-move service is not in a working state. Infoblox returns the following values for states:
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown

trigger.name: bloxTools service not working on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
bloxTools service is not in a working state. Infoblox returns the following values for states:
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown

trigger.name: Grid member role changed on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description: The Infoblox Grid has elected a new master. While this in itself is not a bad thing, it could mean that the previous master failed for some reason and needs investigation.

trigger.name: HTTP service not working on {HOST.NAME}
trigger.description:
HTTP service is not in a working state. Infoblox returns the following values for states:
0 - 1 - Working 2 - 3 - 4 - inactive 5 - unknown
